history.content:
I did CS 61A in the summer and CS 70 + EE 16A in the fall. It is very doable because you don't have to stress about doing well in two classes in a semester to declare. Also you would have a bit more time in the fall to transition yourself to the Berkeley environment if you don't take 61A at the same time. 



tl;dr 61A in the summer, 70 + EE16A in the fall if you can 


———


Wanted to add that Laney is the exception to the 61A rule. You can skip out of it if you took CIS 61 at Laney, 61B if you took CIS 25+27 and maybe 16A as well if you took a circuits class.

I did CS 61A in the summer and CS 70 + EE 16A in the fall. It is very doable because you don't have to stress about doing well in two classes in a semester to declare. Also you would have a bit more time in the fall to transition yourself to the Berkeley environment if you don't take 61A at the same time. 

tl;dr 61A in the summer, 70 + EE16A in the fall if you can

children.subject: My friend was a transfer student and came in and took 61C, 70, and 16A his first semester and did extremely well. It's rough, but it depends on your work ethic. I would caution and suggest only taking CS61A and EE16A at first to get the hang of it.

My first semester as a transfer (EECS) I did 61A,16A and it definitely took me a bit to get used to how things are done here. Second semester I did 61B,70, and 16B. I did well in my courses, but I think I benefitted from having a slightly lighter load my first semester. Adjustment period is different for everyone though.

history.content:
Hello, all. 

I'm a transfer student from Laney College and would like to declare CS major after the first semester.

I've been thinking about taking 61A this summer (on waitlist though). 

My problem is, if I have 61A done in summer, it seems I don't have any choice for fall 2018.

Most likely, I have to take 61C and 70 sooner or later.  Given that I can only take one at a time,

I'm thinking about taking 70 and EE16A (if I take 61A in summer).

But then I'm stuck at choosing the third one. Because I already had GEs and Maths, 

and other CS/EE courses have preresquite on 61 series and 70. 

Any suggestions for that?

The alternative I come up with is to postpone 61A , which means I will take 61A+70+EE16A in fall.

Will that be a possible combination? How about the workload? 

Also, I have questions in ragard to articulated classes.

On assist.org I found that I already took the classes which are equivlant to Cal's 61A and 61B.

However, I've heard a lot of people saying that transfer students have to retake 61A anyway 

because the classes I've taken are too easy (maybe?) compared to the level at Cal.

Still I'd like to take 61A because it's an interesting class and it helps prepare for other courses.

But I don't really want to retake 61B (I took 2 classes at CC for 61B). 

Is there anyone transferred from Peralta System encounter this kind of issues??
history.subject: Is it pratical for a transfer student to take 61A+70+EE16A in fall
